jp.ac.ritsumei.cs.ubi.logger.client.api.matching
クラス CompareOperation

java.lang.Object
  jp.ac.ritsumei.cs.ubi.logger.client.api.matching.Predicate
      jp.ac.ritsumei.cs.ubi.logger.client.api.matching.CompareOperation
直系の既知のサブクラス:
AccelerometerVariation, DoubleCompareOperation, FloatCompareOperation, IntCompareOperation, LatLngCompareOperation, OutdoorRatioCompare, OverlapRatioCompare, StringCompareOperation
public abstract class CompareOperation
extends Predicate

This class detect Compare event. The sensorName corresponded with family of Hbase. The valueName corresponded with columnFamily of Hbase. The attributeName corresponded with columQualifier of Hbase.

作成者:
sacchin

メソッドの詳細

create

public static CompareOperation create(int dataType,
                                      int sensorName,
                                      int valueName,
                                      int attributeName,
                                      int calculater,
                                      int constant)
This is factory method. Please see the MatchingConstatns.class

パラメータ:
dataType - must be "MatchingConstants.DT_INT"
sensorName - means which sensor is used.
valueName - means which value is used.
attributeName - means which attribute is used
calculater - equal or smaller or larger
constant - (int)

                                      int attributeName,

This is factory method. Please see the MatchingConstatns.class

パラメータ:
dataType - must be "MatchingConstants.DT_FLOAT"
sensorName - means which sensor is used.
valueName - means which is used.
attributeName - means which attribute is used
calculater - "equal" or "smaller" or "larger"
constant - value which compare with raw data(float)

This is factory method. Please see the MatchingConstatns.class

パラメータ:
dataType - must be "MatchingConstants.DOUBLE"
family - must be "MatchingConstants.LAT_LNG"
valueName - mean which attribute is used.
attributeName - means which attribute is used
calculater - "equal" or "smaller" or "larger"
constant - value which compare with raw data(double[smallLat, smallLng, largeLat, largeLng])
